sentence.Network_en: He wonders why the digits on his calculator slope to the right.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不明白为什么他的计算器上面的数字向右倾斜。

sentence.Network_en: A pocket calculator only works to eight decimal places.
sentence.Network_cn: 袖珍计算器只能计算到小数点后8位数。

sentence.Network_en: Cross-check your answers with a calculator.
sentence.Network_cn: 用计算器核对一下你的答案。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin, from the verb calculare (see calculate)

entry.def: A calculator is a small electronic device that you use for making mathematical calculations.

means.word_mean: 1. a small machine that is used for mathematical calculations
2. an expert at calculation (or at operating calculating machines)

auth_sentence.content: Using or not a calculator isn't the point.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可计算的, 能预测的
stems_affixes.word_buile: calculate[v.计算,推算;计划,打算]+able能……的→adj.可计算的, 能预测的
re重新+calc石头+itrant表形容词→重新变成石头→顽固的
calc石头+ium表名词,常指化学元素→n.钙[化学符号Ca]
calculate[v.计算,推算;计划,打算]+or物器→n.计算机, 计算器
calc石头+ul+ate表动词→古时用小石计数

sentences.en: The calculator was damaged accidentally, and we needed to buy a new one.
sentences.cn: 这个计算器意外被弄坏了, 我们需要买一个新的。
